701354f-a.text:
Jerome Avenue, west side(Elevated left), south from Bedford Park Boulevard, showing the land adjacent to the Jerome Park Resevoir. On these grounds were later erected the Bronx buildings of Hunter College. In the left background is the armory
on West Kingsbridge Road.
P. L. Sperr  May 8, 1928
NO REPRODUCTIONS  Views 1, 2, 3
701354f-a.folder: Jerome Avenue & Bedford Park Boulevard, Bronx, NY
701354f-a.original_title: Bronx: Jerome Avenue - Bedford Park Boulevard

701354f-b.original_title: Bronx: Jerome Avenue - Bedford Park Boulevard

701355f.text:
(1)
Jerome Ave. (right, on which elevated structure is seen), west side, north from Bedford Park Boulevard to about West Mosholn Parkway South, showing part of the area adjacent to Jerome Park Reservoir being levelled out. This area is now ocoupied by the car yards of the City-owned Independent System (Eighth Ave.) Subway. /w Ws 7eA 3A2g7e9rD Is ei3S(e D MWA)7 C6~~7ew: AeA 3cRe2L
May B, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, as seen from a point on the cleared area.
May 6, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
Another view of the same, at a point farther north.
May 6, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
701355f.folder: Jerome Avenue & Bedford Park Boulevard, Bronx, NY
701355f.original_title: Bronx: Jerome Avenue - Bedford Park Boulevard

701356f.text:
Jerome Ave., west side, south from but not including East 204th Street, to Bedford Park Boulevard, showing the elevated structure of the I.R.T. Jerome Ave.-Woodlawn subway line and its Bedford Park Boulevard station. In the foreground is an Italian vegetable garden.
May s, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
701356f.folder: Jerome Avenue & Bedford Park Boulevard, Bronx, NY
701356f.original_title: Bronx: Jerome Avenue - Bedford Park Boulevard

701351f-b.text:
(1)
Jerome Ave. (right, elevated thereon), eest side, north from Bedford Park Boulevard (point of vantage), showing the Concourse yard of the City-Owned Independent System subway. Beyond that appears the high service station of the I.R.T. subway system.
May 5, 1938.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
Another view across the car yard. In the far background is
visible De Witt Clinton High School.
May 5, 1938.
P. L. Sperr.
